messages.message: Hey Russia, looking forward to a great game 🙃. I think we should discuss Scandinavia 😉 and how to split it up. I’m not interested in attacking you, at least for a while. Hopefully you feel the same way. Anyways, good luck and have fun!
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hey Russia, looking forward to a great game 🙃. I think we should discuss Scandinavia 😉 and how to split it up. I’m not interested in attacking you, at least for a while. Hopefully you feel the same way. Anyways, good luck and have fun!'.

messages.output: You should trust the message from RUSSIA. This message sets a positive tone for collaborative efforts moving forward.

messages.message: I suppose. Any way I can persuade you to give me my supply center back?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I suppose. Any way I can persuade you to give me my supply center back?'.

messages.message:
Considering you tried to land an army, clearly aiming to overpower first St. Petersburg and then Sweden and so on and so forth, I would rather not if I'm honest. It pains me to see that I guessed correctly that you'd try to launch an offensive, but I'm not fool enough to step aside and let it happen now that I know. No offense.

You could likely walk into Belgium though, considering the Germans and French have talked (Partly through me, which was weird tbh) and agreed that the Germans will walk out, and the French will occupy it with a single unit; you could overpower that easily. I doubt that's part of your plan though all things considered.
messages.input:
Message from RUSSIA:'Considering you tried to land an army, clearly aiming to overpower first St. Petersburg and then Sweden and so on and so forth, I would rather not if I'm honest. I doubt that's part of your plan though all things considered.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from RUSSIA. messages.message: You sure? France said they were going to support themselves in and, so far they have been 100% honest with me. messages.message:
I'm just telling you what they told me dawg.

And I'm afraid that for defensive purposes, relinquishing Norway at this point isn't really an option. I can assist you in taking Denmark, and possibly Kiel so long as I get Berlin, but Norway is too vital. I'd need you to get out of the Barents first of course.

This message suggests a principled and calculated decision-making process in diplomacy.
